title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement b-cubedsupport@meisebotanicgarden.. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to b3gbi
text: outlines propose change b3gbi. detailed discussion contributing tidyverse packages, please see development contributing guide code review principles.

title: Contributing to b3gbi
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to b3gbi
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed). See guide create great issue advice.

title: Contributing to b3gbi
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("b-cubed-eu/b3gbi", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to b3gbi
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to b3gbi
text: Please note b3gbi project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

what: General Biodiversity Indicators for Biodiversity Data Cubes
title: General Biodiversity Indicators for Biodiversity Data Cubes
text: Analyze biodiversity trends spatial patterns GBIF data cubes, using flexible indicators like richness, evenness, .

title: General Biodiversity Indicators for Biodiversity Data Cubes
text: Biodiversity researchers need robust standardized tools analyze vast amounts data available platforms like GBIF. b3gbi package leverages power data cubes streamline biodiversity assessments. helps researchers gain insights : Changes Time: biodiversity metrics shift throughout years. Spatial Variations: Differences biodiversity across regions, identifying hotspots areas concern. Impact Factors: different environmental variables human activities might affect biodiversity patterns.

title: General Biodiversity Indicators for Biodiversity Data Cubes
text: b3gbi empowers biodiversity analysis : Standardized Workflows: Simplify process calculating common biodiversity indicators GBIF data cubes. Flexibility: Calculate richness, evenness, rarity, taxonomic distinctness, Shannon-Hill diversity, Simpson-Hill diversity, . Analysis Options: Explore temporal trends create spatial maps. Visualization Tools: Generate publication-ready plots biodiversity metrics.

title: General Biodiversity Indicators for Biodiversity Data Cubes
text: can install development version b3gbi GitHub :

title: General Biodiversity Indicators for Biodiversity Data Cubes
text: basic example shows calculate plot map species richness data cube containing GBIF occurrence data amphibians Europe:
code: # Load package library(b3gbi)  # Load GBIF data cube cube_name <- system.file("extdata", "europe_species_cube.csv", package = "b3gbi")  # Load taxonomic info for cube tax_info <- system.file("extdata", "europe_species_info.csv", package = "b3gbi")  # Prepare cube insect_data <- process_cube(cube_name, tax_info)  # Calculate diversity metric map_obs_rich_insects <- obs_richness_map(insect_data)  # Plot diversity metric plot(map_obs_rich_insects, title = "Observed Species Richness: Insects in Europe")

(Uses data cube default.) last_year Exclude data year. (Uses data cube default.)

what: b3gbi: General Biodiversity Indicators for Biodiversity Data Cubes — b3gbi-package
title: b3gbi: General Biodiversity Indicators for Biodiversity Data Cubes — b3gbi-package
text: Calculate general biodiversity indicators GBIF data cubes. Includes many common indicators species richness evenness, can calculated time (trends) space (maps).

title: b3gbi: General Biodiversity Indicators for Biodiversity Data Cubes — b3gbi-package
text: Maintainer: Shawn Dove Shawn.Dove@allzool.bio.uni-giessen.de (ORCID)

what: Calculate Biodiversity Indicators Over Space — calc_map.obs_richness
title: Calculate Biodiversity Indicators Over Space — calc_map.obs_richness
text: function provides flexible framework calculating various biodiversity indicators spatial grid time series. prepares data, creates grid, calculates indicators, formats output appropriate S3 object ('indicator_map'). Specific implementations different indicator types provided using appropriate wrappers.

title: Calculate Biodiversity Indicators Over Space — calc_map.obs_richness
code: # S3 method for obs_richness calc_map(x, ...)  # S3 method for total_occ calc_map(x, ...)  # S3 method for newness calc_map(x, newness_min_year = NULL, ...)  # S3 method for occ_density calc_map(x, ...)  # S3 method for williams_evenness calc_map(x, ...)  # S3 method for pielou_evenness calc_map(x, ...)  # S3 method for ab_rarity calc_map(x, ...)  # S3 method for area_rarity calc_map(x, ...)  calc_map(x, ...)

title: Calculate Biodiversity Indicators Over Space — calc_map.obs_richness
text: x data cube object ('processed_cube'). ... Additional arguments passed specific indicator calculation functions. type indicator calculate. Supported options include: 'obs_richness': Observed species richness. 'total_occ': Total number occurrences. 'newness': Mean year occurrence. 'occ_density': Density occurrences. 'williams_evenness', 'pielou_evenness': Evenness measures. 'ab_rarity', 'area_rarity':  Abundance-based area-based rarity scores. cell_size Length grid cell sides, km. (Default: 10 country, 100 continent world) level Spatial level: 'continent', 'country', 'world'. (Default: 'continent') region region interest (e.g., "Europe"). (Default: "Europe")

title: Calculate Biodiversity Indicators Over Space — calc_map.obs_richness
text: S3 object class 'indicator_map' containing calculated indicator values metadata.

title: Calculate Biodiversity Indicators Over Space — calc_map.obs_richness

title: Plot Biodiversity Indicator Map — plot_map
text: Creates map visualization calculated biodiversity indicator, providing customization options.

title: Plot Biodiversity Indicator Map — plot_map
code: plot_map(   x,   title = "auto",   auto_title = NULL,   leg_label_default = NULL,   xlims = NULL,   ylims = NULL,   trans = NULL,   breaks = NULL,   labels = NULL,   Europe_crop = TRUE,   surround = TRUE,   panel_bg = NULL,   legend_title = NULL,   legend_limits = NULL,   legend_title_wrap_length = 10,   title_wrap_length = 60 )

title: Plot Biodiversity Indicator Map — plot_map
text: x 'indicator_map' object containing indicator values associated map grid cells. title Plot title. Replace "auto" title want custom title calling function manually. auto_title Text automatic title generation, provided appropriate S3 method (calling function manually, leave NULL). leg_label_default Default label legend, provided appropriate S3 method (calling function manually, leave NULL). xlims (Optional) Custom x-axis limits. ylims (Optional) Custom y-axis limits. trans (Optional) Scale transformation fill gradient (e.g., 'log'). breaks (Optional) Break points legend scale. labels (Optional) Labels legend scale break points. Europe_crop TRUE, crops maps Europe exclude far-lying islands. surround TRUE, includes surrounding countries gray plotting country level. panel_bg (Optional) Background color map panel. legend_title (Optional) Title plot legend. legend_limits (Optional) Limits legend scale. wrap_length Maximum title length wrapping new line.

title: Plot Biodiversity Indicator Map — plot_map
text: ggplot object representing biodiversity indicator map. Can customized using ggplot2 functions.

title: Plot Biodiversity Indicator Map — plot_map
code: plot_map(x = example_indicator_map1, title = "Map of Species Evenness in Denmark")

title: Plot Biodiversity Indicator Trend — plot_ts
text: Creates time series plot calculated biodiversity indicator, optional smoothed trendline, visualizes uncertainty.

title: Plot Biodiversity Indicator Trend — plot_ts
code: plot_ts(   x,   title = "auto",   auto_title = NULL,   y_label_default = NULL,   suppress_y = FALSE,   smoothed_trend = TRUE,   linecolour = NULL,   trendlinecolour = NULL,   envelopecolour = NULL,   gridoff = FALSE,   x_label = NULL,   y_label = NULL,   min_year = NULL,   max_year = NULL,   x_breaks = 10,   y_breaks = 6,   wrap_length = 60 )

title: Plot Biodiversity Indicator Trend — plot_ts
text: x 'indicator_ts' object containing time series indicator values. title Plot title. Replace "auto" title want custom title calling function manually. auto_title Text automatic title generation, provided appropriate S3 method (calling function manually, leave NULL). y_label_default Default label y-axis, provided appropriate S3 method (calling function manually, leave NULL). suppress_y TRUE, suppresses y-axis labels. smoothed_trend TRUE, plot smoothed trendline. linecolour (Optional) Colour indicator line. Default darkorange. trendlinecolour (Optional) Colour smoothed trendline. Default blue. envelopecolour (Optional) Colour uncertainty envelope. Default lightsteelblue. gridoff TRUE, hides gridlines. x_label Label x-axis. y_label Label y-axis. min_year (Optional)  Earliest year include plot. max_year (Optional)  Latest year include plot. x_breaks Integer giving desired number breaks x axis. (May return exactly number requested.) y_breaks Integer giving desired number breaks y axis. (May return exactly number requested.) wrap_length Maximum title length wrapping new line.

title: Plot Biodiversity Indicator Trend — plot_ts
text: ggplot object representing biodiversity indicator time series plot. Can customized using ggplot2 functions.

title: Plot Biodiversity Indicator Trend — plot_ts
code: # default colours: plot_ts(example_indicator_ts1, y_label = "Species Richness", title = "Observed Species Richness: Mammals in Denmark")   # custom colours: plot_ts(example_indicator_ts1,         y_label = "Species Richness",         title = "Observed Species Richness: Mammals in Denmark",         linecolour = "thistle",         trendlinecolour = "forestgreen",         envelopecolour = "lightgreen")

title: Print an Indicator Map Object — print.indicator_map
code: library(sf) #> Linking to GEOS 3.10.2, GDAL 3.4.1, PROJ 8.2.1; sf_use_s2() is TRUE print(example_indicator_map1) #> Gridded biodiversity indicator map #>  #> Name of Indicator: Pielou's Evenness  #>  #> Map of Denmark  #>  #> Projection: ETRS89-extended / LAEA Europe  #>  #> Coordinate range: #>    xmin    ymin    xmax    ymax  #> 4203206 3503488 4648847 3848491  #>  #> Grid cell size:  km^2  #> Number of cells: 576  #>  #> Observation years: 1970 - 2020  #> Total years with observations: 54  #>  #> Number of species represented: 110  #> Number of families represented:   #>  #> Kingdoms represented: Animalia  #>  #> First 10 rows of data (use n = to show more): #>  #> # A tibble: 576 × 3 #>    cellid area_km2 diversity_val #>     <int>   [km^2]         <dbl> #>  1      1    9.21          0.623 #>  2      2   60.7           0.612 #>  3      3   83.5           0.751 #>  4      4   62.7           0.736 #>  5      5    7.05          0.474 #>  6      6    0.410         0.518 #>  7      7    6.26          0.706 #>  8      8    1.68          0.625 #>  9      9   42.1           0.623 #> 10     10   33.1           0.528 #> # ℹ 566 more rows

code: print(example_cube_1) #>  #> Processed data cube for calculating biodiversity indicators #>  #> Date Range: 1751 - 2023  #> Single-resolution cube with cell size 1km ^2 #> Number of cells: 52582  #> Coordinate range: #> xmin xmax ymin ymax  #> 2983 5749 2667 5995  #>  #> Total number of observations: 431801  #> Number of species represented: 110  #> Number of families represented:   #>  #> Kingdoms represented: Animalia  #>  #> First 10 rows of data (use n = to show more): #>  #> # A tibble: 276,950 × 10 #>     year eea_cell_code taxonKey   obs scientificName rank  kingdom xcoord ycoord #>    <dbl> <chr>            <dbl> <dbl> <chr>          <fct> <fct>    <dbl>  <dbl> #>  1  1751 1kmE4461N3660  5219243     1 Vulpes vulpes… SPEC… Animal…   4461   3660 #>  2  1751 1kmE4462N3656  5219243     1 Vulpes vulpes… SPEC… Animal…   4462   3656 #>  3  1820 1kmE4239N3764  2439449     1 Sicista betul… SPEC… Animal…   4239   3764 #>  4  1862 1kmE4317N3769  5219833     1 Micromys minu… SPEC… Animal…   4317   3769 #>  5  1862 1kmE4319N3769  5219833     1 Micromys minu… SPEC… Animal…   4319   3769 #>  6  1863 1kmE4312N3775  2439449     1 Sicista betul… SPEC… Animal…   4312   3775 #>  7  1863 1kmE4318N3770  5219833     1 Micromys minu… SPEC… Animal…   4318   3770 #>  8  1870 1kmE4317N3770  2432439     1 Myotis dauben… SPEC… Animal…   4317   3770 #>  9  1872 1kmE4294N3622  2439449     1 Sicista betul… SPEC… Animal…   4294   3622 #> 10  1874 1kmE4319N3767  2432439     1 Myotis dauben… SPEC… Animal…   4319   3767 #> # ℹ 276,940 more rows #> # ℹ 1 more variable: resolution <chr>

title: Process GBIF Data Cubes — process_cube
text: Processes GBIF data cube associated taxonomic information file. files must reside directory share base file name (e.g., 'my_mammals_cube.csv', 'my_mammals_info.csv').

title: Process GBIF Data Cubes — process_cube
code: process_cube(   cube_name,   tax_info = NULL,   datasets_info = NULL,   first_year = NULL,   last_year = NULL )

title: Process GBIF Data Cubes — process_cube
text: cube_name location name data cube file (e.g., 'inst/extdata/europe_species_cube.csv'). tax_info location name associated taxonomic info file (e.g.,  'inst/extdata/europe_species_info.csv'). datasets_info location name associated dataset info file (e.g., 'inst/extdata/europe_species_datasets.csv'). first_year (Optional) first year occurrences include. specified, uses earliest year present cube. last_year (Optional) final year occurrences include. specified, uses latest year present cube.

title: Process GBIF Data Cubes — process_cube
text: tibble containing processed GBIF occurrence data.

title: Process GBIF Data Cubes — process_cube
code: if (FALSE) { cube_name <- system.file("extdata", "europe_species_cube.csv", package = "b3gbi") tax_info <- system.file("extdata", "europe_species_info.csv", package = "b3gbi") europe_example_cube <- process_cube(cube_name, tax_info) europe_example_cube }

what: Calculate Total Occurrences Over Space — total_occ_map
title: Calculate Total Occurrences Over Space — total_occ_map
text: function calculates total number species occurrence records gridded map.

title: Calculate Total Occurrences Over Space — total_occ_map
Calculate Total Occurrences Over Space — total_occ_map
text: x data cube object (class 'processed_cube'). cell_size Length grid cell sides, km. (Default: 10 country, 100 continent world) level Spatial level: 'continent', 'country', 'world'. (Default: 'continent') region region interest (e.g., "Europe"). (Default: "Europe") cube_crs projection cube. (Default: "EPSG:3035") first_year Exclude data year. (Uses data cube default.) last_year Exclude data year. (Uses data cube default.)

title: Calculate Total Occurrences Over Space — total_occ_map
text: S3 object classes 'indicator_map' 'total_occ' containing calculated indicator values metadata.

title: Calculate Total Occurrences Over Space — total_occ_map
